intro: Thomsonaria caloneura subsp. caloneura, commonly known as the slender-leaved thomsonaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
